Board of Adjustments
Board of Adjustments

The purpose of the Board of Adjustments is to hear and decide all appeals and to render an interpretation of the zoning regulations or the manner of their application, to hear and decide upon those applications for a special exception to use or develop property, and to authorize a variance from zoning regulations.

The Board of Adjustments meet on call only the 2nd Thursday of the month at 1:15 p.m.

The Board of Adjustments consists of seven members that serve two years with no compensation.  Members are nominated by the Board and approved by a majority of the City Council.

![](https://cityofgladewater.com/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=q%2F%2FOnaGNkaFbegf4ieiHHjUHgEMqJNXjc2cFmHDVXFNR1IPgiAP3m9uNgPj3EPb5&s=small)

BRANDY FLANAGAN

EX-OFFICIO

**2024 - 2026**  
  
Brandy J. Flanagan is a distinguished entrepreneur and business consultant with over 20 years of successful experience in the East Texas Region. Her expertise spans nearly a decade in business consulting, where she has guided countless entrepreneurs through her private practice and the Small Business Development Center, an affiliate of the SBA. Known for her ability to help businesses start, grow, and overcome challenges, Brandy has become a trusted advisor to small business owners and community leaders alike.  
  
In addition to her consulting work, Brandy has played a significant role in public service. She served on the City Council for six years before being elected as the first female Mayor of Gladewater, Texas, in 2024. Her leadership and dedication to her community earned her the prestigious Regional Statesman Award in 2023.  
  
Brandy is the author of Make Business Fun Again: Lightbulb Moments of a Real Entrepreneur, a book that reflects her practical and innovative approach to business. She is also a sought-after keynote speaker, podcast guest, and panelist known for sharing her insights on business strategy and community development.  
  
She is the creator of the Entrepreneurship BootCamp, a program taught at local colleges, and Vault.Biz, an innovative online resource hub designed to support small business owners launching in 2025.  
  
Renowned for her out-of-the-box strategies and problem-solving skills, Brandy approaches every challenge with directness and a friendly southern smile. Her work extends beyond individual businesses; she collaborates with elected officials, economic development corporations, and chambers of commerce to drive community growth through effective business development.  
  
Brandy J. Flanagan's career is marked by her commitment to empowering entrepreneurs and fostering economic development, making her a pivotal figure in the East Texas business community.

![](https://cityofgladewater.com/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=AuXoBKyJDXO0KQteeX9oX%2FiyKu2DpzTcmfqPlpvA8HUWEUqPoNMAzKii%2FZ%2Fabvhx&s=small)

JUDY VANHOUTEN, TRMC

SECRETARY

**JOB SUMMARY** – The City Secretary gives notice of all official meetings, keeps the journal and minute books of their proceedings, authenticates by her signature and record in full, in a book kept for that purpose, all ordinances and resolutions.  She prepares and posts meeting agendas for the Council and all City Boards according to the Open Meetings Act.  The City Secretary serves as the election official for all City elections, general and special.  She is the custodian of the official city seal and attests the mayor’s signature on all official documents and performs all other duties required by charter or by ordinance.

**PERSONAL PROFILE** – Judy is a 1987 Graduate of Gladewater High School.  With the exception of 12 years spent in the Dallas area, Judy is a lifelong resident of Gladewater.  She has worked for the City of Gladewater since 2009 and was appointed City Clerk in April 2018.  Her son, Brian and step-daughter, Holly are her biggest fans.  When not attending to city business she loves to read, crochet and spend time with her family.
